text: Hey guys - could you confirm something for me: HubSpot's built-in image optimisation, is it limited to HubSpot's standard image module, and therefore not compatible with custom modules (and lazy load)? Or will image optimisation continue to apply if we move to the custom module approach? Documentation says any image with height and width attributes will be resized automatically, but I would like to confirm if this applies universally.

Has anyone who owns the website on HubSpot, and has the whole website redesigned?
I wonder if working with '*Content Staging'* is enough? Or develop on a 'sandbox account' and then import the site later?
_Cheers_
I've built a ton of sites in content staging. Works perfectly
If I wanted to create a picklist of social media icons in a custom module what would be the best way to do that?
It is not limited to the standard image module. It is indeed compatible with custom modules AND native lazy loading.
It wouldn’t be limited to just social media icons but I’ve found using the  Icon field (that pulls from FontAwesome free) is a good solution.

Thank you, but what I mean is like I need to create a new site and it will be able to review and when it ready it will be replaced the current one.
Working with content staging is for redesign the page for current site.
Am I right? Or anything miss about content staging?

Hello dear HubSpoters,
We are using this snippet to share articles in HubSpot. The idea is to get a new window with a preview of the articles for social share.
The problems is that it works only the second or third time we click on it.
The first time you click on it it opens a windows, but only the link of the post is visible, with no meta description or featured image. The second or third click, the post gets formatted correctly. It’s pretty strange.
Any idea or suggestion will be very usefull!
Thanks

I am having some trouble with Google Search Console (GSC) related to HubSpot. I want to remove a GSC user but I cannot because GSC says that the verification file for that user is still on the site. I deleted the verification file in the HubSpot file manager and cannot find it on the site myself. Does anyone know why GSC still thinks the file is on the HubSpot site? The file name is <https://www.blacklinegrp.com/googleeab34a68f817ec12.html|googleeab34a68f817ec12.html>. The website is <https://www.blacklinegrp.com/>

Should HubSpot remember the language selected by the user for multi-language sites or is it up to ourselves to take care of that? Only found a couple of years old post on this channel that said it might remember, but at least on my test site this does not happen and I'm shown the default language front page instead of being redirected to the language variant I last used

I’m building a blog for a client, here: <http://7659585.hs-sites.com/blog?hsCacheBuster=5454>. Currently older posts are being pulled into a three column grid at the bottom of the page. In each blog item I am pulling in the featured image, title and the first 80 characters from the post body.

However the client would like to right their own short snippet of the blog summary and have it “bubble up” here - instead of the first 80 characters from the post body. Is there a way to accomplish that?
I created a custom module called “Blog Summary” - and I am trying to pull that into the listing page - without much luck.
Not sure, website looks good though
Can anyone recommend any article about how to reduce low text-HTML ratio?  We are getting some warning in our SEM Rush account.
Do you have a blog on your website? That's a good way to work on off balancing it
